e4: Although there might be a short-term adjustment period for investors, long-term ethical implications and investor trust outweigh the potential for temporary market confusion.  A transparent reporting system fosters confidence and credibility for ABC in the market.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes truthful and transparent communication of financial information.  It aims for accuracy, clarity, and comprehensibility for investors, even if it presents challenges. It also considers the potential impact on all stakeholders and strives to build long-term trust and confidence.
e6: Yes. I would ask about their plan to communicate the policy change to investors, how they will address investor concerns and potential confusion, and what measures they will take to ensure accurate reporting going forward.
